numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Very wealthy families are more likely to be admitted to college.
2. Families with legacy status are more likely to be admitted to college.
3. Both graphs have a spike near the 99.9th income percentile.
4. The legacy line is darker than the non-legacy line.
5. The legacy line is far above the non-legacy line near the 99.9th income percentile.
6. I wonder why colleges prioritize legacy students.
8. My classmates are applying to college.
9. The graphs show a disparity between legacy applicants and non-legacy applicants.
10. The graphs show a disparity between wealthy applicants and less wealthy applicants.
11. The headline is: College admissions: a legacy of pandering to wealth.
